intro: Coccoloba fallax, commonly known as the rock nettle, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family, characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, adapting to saline and well-drained soils. Its leaves are often hairy and have a distinctive net-veined pattern, which gives it its common name. Coccoloba fallax is also known for its ability to thrive in harsh environmental conditions.
